intro: Osmorhiza edulis, commonly known as sweet cicely, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its edible roots and leaves are used in various culinary applications, adding a licorice-like flavor. Osmorhiza edulis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
